title: [feature request] put tensor shape and type back in printout
body_html:
I'm sure there's some reason as to why the tensor shape (dimensions) and type are no longer included (as of 0.4) when print x is called on some tensor x, but why? It can be extremely useful, especially when viewing the contents of large tensors. Could this information be re-added in a future release? I know I could also just do

print x
print x.shape
print x.type()

but that's extra work ;-)

body:
I'm sure there's some reason as to why the tensor shape (dimensions) and type are no longer included (as of 0.4) when `print x` is called on some tensor `x`, but why? It can be extremely useful, especially when viewing the contents of large tensors. Could this information be re-added in a future release? I know I could also just do

```
print x
print x.shape
print x.type()
```

but that's extra work ;-)
